New Records: Virat Kohli scored his 48th ODI hundred
Virat Kohli reached his hundred with a six
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma holes out, Kohli tees off
Kohli reaches his hundred with a six
Shreyas Iyer errs, Bangladesh bag a third
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib Al Hasan has been ruled out for Bangladesh
Bangladesh will be lacking the small matter of 7439 ODI runs and 313 wickets
Najmul Hossain Shanto is getting ready to lead the team in Shakib's absence
Shakib and Taskin are out, Hasan Mahmud and Nasum Ahmed are in
Rohit says he would have bowled first
In this World Cup, keeping everyone in a good space is the biggest challenge, and you're moving from one place to another. We're enjoying our cricket and want to continue the momentum.
Post-Match Reflections: Kohli has his 48th ODI hundred (oh, and India won by seven wickets, but that is clearly the secondary consideration right now...!)
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won by 7 wickets (with 51 balls remaining)
Bangladesh won the toss and bat
Shanto wins the toss and chooses to bat
Bangladesh have won three of their last four ODIs against India, including at the Asia Cup last month
